page.title: 07My visit to Hopton Farm.
page.content: Hopton Farm is a dairy farm which grows corn and grass for silage. The farm covers about 300 acres,and employs 4 people. They have installed computers to assist with their work. The 98 cows are milked at 5:45 in the morning and again at 3:45 in the afternoon. They feed the cows on grass,corn and silage.The milk the cows give goes to Birmingham Co-op.They breed their own cows.These are the pieces of machinery we saw ;5 tractors,a forage harvester,a bailer,a plough,a sprayer, an elevator,a harrow and a mill and mixer.The way calves sucked the ladyÂ£s fingers,without hurting her,interested me! Glyn Thomas aged 9.
